definition: Wu Song, a heroic outlaw of Liangshan po 梁山泊 in the classic novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传, whose exploits including killing a tiger with his bare hands
martial/military
surname Wu
pine/CL:棵[ke1]
surname Song

sentences.english: Wu Song fought the tiger, with a stick his only weapon.
sentences.chinese: 武松打虎，手中只有一根棍子作爲武器。

sentences.english: Part Four: Comparison of analogy in"WuSong".
sentences.chinese: 第四章爲“《武松》比喻的相關比較”。

sentences.english: After that day, Wu Sung dwelled at his brother's house. More than a month passed.
sentences.chinese: 自此，武松便以哥嫂家爲家，不覺一個多月過去。

sentences.english: Nice Wu song from the "Iron Flag" album.
sentences.chinese: 尼斯的武松從鐵旗專輯。

sentences.english: It's a piece of cake. Why not invite the Kongfu master Wu Song to give us a hand ?
sentences.chinese: 沒事兒，咱請功夫了得的武松助我一臂之力。

sentences.english: Wu Song struck the tiger again and again with his massive fist.
sentences.chinese: 武松用他巨大的拳頭不停地打那老虎。

sentences.english: The drawing of fighting tigers in Tang Dynasty is true source of the drawing of Wu Song 's fighting tigers.
sentences.chinese: 唐人的打虎場面刻畫，是武松打虎描寫的真正源頭。

definition: Lin Chong, one of the Heroes of the Marsh in Water Margin
Li Kui, character in the novel Water Margin 水滸全傳|水浒全传[Shui3 hu3 quan2 zhuan4]
Song Jiang, a principal hero of the novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传
Ximen Qing, character from 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2] and 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
Pan Jinlian (name lit. Golden Lotus), heroine of Ming dynasty vernacular novel Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus 金瓶梅
Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh by Shi Nai'an 施耐庵[Shi1 Nai4 an1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature
Liangshan city and County in Jining 濟寧|济宁[Ji3 ning2], Shandong
edge of the water/shore or sea, lake or river/seashore
Wu Yong, character of 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], nicknamed Resourceful Star 智多星[Zhi4 duo1 xing1]
Huang Xin, character in The Water Margin
Wang Ying (character in the "Water Margin")
Shi Nai'an (1296-1371), author of Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
Fang La
hero/strong and courageous person/CL:條|条[tiao2]
Zhu Bajie, character in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记, with pig-like characteristics and armed with a muckrake/Pigsy in Arthur Waley's translation
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]/Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
